metadata.title: CVE-2024-31950 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In FRRouting (FRR) through 9.1, there can be a buffer overflow and daemoncrash in ospf_te_parse_ri for OSPF LSA packets during an attempt to readSegment Routing subTLVs (their size is not validated).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-31950` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu6.1
frr-pythontools - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu6.1
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu6.1
frr-snmp - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu6.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.4.4-1.1ubuntu6.1').
